summary:
• A specialist in Islamic architecture and arts from the universities of Syria, Egypt, and the Netherlands
• More than 20 years of experience as an archaeologist and researcher in Egypt, Syria, and the Netherlands ‏• More than 15 years of experience in developing archaeological and tourist areas and projects for the restoration and revitalization of cultural heritage sites in Syria and Egypt
• Proven successful track record in leadership positions, as Director of Archaeological Research and Training, Damascus, Syria, as the head of the national team responsible for registering the Dead Cities (a Syrian archaeological site) and several pertinent national and international restoration and rehabilitation projects
• I held leadership positions in numerous scientific and academic institutions and supervised many doctoral and master's theses. I have published many books, studies, and articles on the archeology, restoration, and rehabilitation of cultural heritage areas and their relationship to national identity.
• Doctorate and academic titles recognized by the Dutch Ministry of Higher Education
• Founder of the Arabic-Dutch Cultural House in the Netherlands I am a research fellow at the Netherlands Institute for Advanced Studies in the Humanities and Social Sciences, Amsterdam, the Netherlands.
• Head of the Department of Islamic Antiquities in Syria's Encyclopedia of the Antiquities Authority.

Copper Coins minted in Damascus...pdf', 'description': 'Fulüs, the plural of fals, is originally a Greek-Latin
form (ΦΟΛΛΙΣ), which might derive indirectly
from Aramaic or Hebrew1. The word reached the
Arab world through the Byzantines and was ‘Arabicised’
from the word follis, which most likely
meant the struck coinage made of red copper,
although it was also used for struck coinage made
of bronze.
After the Islamic conquest, the Arabs used
these fulüs in business, retaining the original foreign
designation. ', 'image': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C512DAQH-cAYJqCPkCA/profile-treasury-document-cover-images_1920/0/1584042872657?e=1692889200&v=beta&t=5hqubIvEL2G7hzifp_QskYm3CO7M1QXuzyZSbzrPoU0'}, {'url': None, 'title': '0001.jpg', 'description': '', 'image': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C512DAQH0LyPqMjslxA/profile-treasury-image-shrink_8192_8192/0/1602212131597?e=1692889200&v=beta&t=7KGW5U5N4T7mLRA3aIIp480zZ1ru8L2_Dw_iqloHQsM'}, {'url': 'https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCniKEtDujGPXAm2p-Z3wOUw', 'title': 'Islamic Archaeology With Dr.Ghazwan Yaghi', 'description': 'The channel aims to publicize Islamic art and civilization; It is a personal effort to simplify the explanation of Islamic art, and to spread its intermediate culture, and spot the light on its most important characteristics and civilizational meanings away from exaggeration and fanaticism.
The canal now contains three documentaries on Islamic art, with an integrated plan to publish about 50 videos on the same subject in the coming period.', 'image': None}, {'url': None, 'title': '0001 (1).jpg', 'description': '', 'image': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C512DAQHgcmXMLzByMA/profile-treasury-image-shrink_8192_8192/0/1601660329629?e=1692889200&v=beta&t=bfJxdLag0XxwFM-qP5j4_AED6u6pTEu_lcHjLorYOSg'}, {'url': None, 'title': 'Ghazwan Yaghi', 'description': 'Fulus is the plural of Fils, a Greek Latin name and maybe an indirect derivation from Aramaean or Hebrew. However, it reached to the Arabs from Byzantine and derived the arabic spelling word follis which means coins made of copper or... more Fulus is...', 'image': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C4E2DAQHMyiZg5H8DQg/profile-treasury-image-shrink_8192_8192/0/1657267440624?e=1692889200&v=beta&t=xcZz6vIlB95pKrltBze4mr4j3wkkZT33hSNqZ2bhWw4'}]
